Reviews.Title: “great budget, clean, close to main attractions”
Reviews.Author: JulieKas26
Reviews.Content: spend 3 nights here with a friend of mine, yes the rooms are small but they are stylish and comfy. even though it's locaction is close to the central station it is quiet at night thanks to good isolation. the breakfast was amazing and staff is friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Super value for money! Felt like home here!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel7837
Reviews.Content: I was very happy I chose this hotel, because you cannot possibly get better value for this price. It is very relaxing, and is located in a nice area not far away from the Central Station and major sites like Brandenburg Gate and Richstag. It's a completely new property with great and innovative design, especially I liked the "fireplace" on the TV screens in the lobby and the rooms. Friendly and helpful staff. People who stay there are mostly business travelers. Very nice breakfast for cheap price, and this price also includes the use of wifi. The only minus was: the towels weren't changed every day, so rather put them on the floor if you want clean ones. Other than that, everything else was perfect. Every night I couldn't wait to return to my Berlin home, and if I ever return back to Berlin this is where I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great design, no fuss, no frills”
Reviews.Author: RAJ51
Reviews.Content: Up to date, modern design in spartan (no coffe pot, no iron, no telephone, no cupboard, no drawers) accomodation at a reasonable price. Great for the short stay road road warrior. Wifi in the room free with buffet breakfast rate, free in the lobby. Good German buffet breakfast, fresh fruit, salami, cheese, etc. Only sandwiches available after breakfast. Lobby spacious enough for informal meetings, bar on site. Excellent staff, arrived 9:00am after a transatlantic flight and was allowed check in before the official 3:00pm time without fuss. Responsive and helpful on all other ocassions. Not a lot happening in the immediate vicinity. Bus stop ouside with link to Tegel Airport

Reviews.Title: “Will for sure be back!”
Reviews.Author: TravelQueen1980
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this beautiful hotel last year and this year in March and I enjoyed both times very much. It is within walking distance from the central station (15 mins) and just a few minutes away from the station Bellevue. The people at the reception are friendly and helpful and the rooms are very modern and beautiful and also very quiet! You are in a quiet part of the city but very close to the city. Breakfast can be added for 7 or 8 Euros and contains everything you would want for a good breakfast. Will definitely come back when in Berlin the next time!

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel in a sleepy (though well-connected) area”
Reviews.Author: 1stClassLounge
Reviews.Content: Believe the hype -- for a very low price you can have a clean, comfortable and modern room in a lovely hotel with great staff, free wi-fi, and breakfast. The rooms are really great, with comfortable beds and flat screen tv. Staff was always helpful and friendly. Breakfast is your European standard cheese and meat and muesli affair, no complaints. Motel One has eliminated a few frills that you will probably not miss -- there are no in-room phones, for example. So if you want to reach another guest, you need to leave a message at reception or get their mobile number. No big deal. The only tiny fly in the ointment is that you are not exactly in the center of the action at this location. You're only a few minutes walk from an S-Bahn station, but if you are planning some late nights enjoying Berlin's legendary nightlife, you will be shelling out for taxis to take you back to the hotel. If you're not much for nightlife then you will find it hard to find better value for money than Motel One Bellevue in Berlin. And even if you are a partier, a few taxis is not so bad -- from this hotel to Kreuzberg is about 15 EUR.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: singlefemale
Reviews.Content: Loved the concept of motel one - I wish there were more around the world. Really nice rooms, small and well furnished, and an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: BCKL78
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights over a very full sightseeing weekend. Room spotless and functional. 5 min walk to Bellevue S-Bahn, 15 min walk to main train station. Gas station with mini-market across the street. Room included internet and breakfast, which was fresh and nicely presented. Lobby featured a 24-hour bar. All this for 67 Euros/night. I'd do it again without questions.

Reviews.Title: “Must have had me in mind when they designed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: OlympeDeGouges
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just the way I like it - quiet, clean, bright and attractive, a good firm mattress, an excellent shower, windows that open as well as air-con, a nice flat-screen t.v., very friendly reception, good value breakfast and good value overall. Any quibbles I had were very minor, e.g. there was Darjeeling or Earl Grey but no English Breakfast tea for breakfast; rather more importantly there were lots of t.v. channels but nearly all rubbish and nearly all in German (at least, thankfully, there was BBC World). The location suited me but the immediate surroundings are not very fashionable and there's not a large choice of places to eat on the doorstep. (I didn't need a meal, but I noticed a cafe/restaurant called Cabinett two minutes' walk away that seemed to have a good range of value dishes at reasonable prices). I would definitely stay here again and would try other Motel Ones after such a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Better than it looks”
Reviews.Author: Mconstantino
Reviews.Content: You may think there's something wrong with these "motel ones" because their great values and beautiful design. There isn't. They're good and they have excellent prices. This was the first one we stayed and i was looking for someting close to themain station. This one is in a 15 min walk from there, or just 2 SBahn stations (they're building another one just in front of the Berlin hbf). Very quiet area (the only sound we heard was the SBahn passing by), just above the Tiergarten. Great staff, excellent rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely new hotel, convenient location, thin walls”
Reviews.Author: KellsBells2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over New Year 09/10. The hotel was really impressive on first appearance for it's rating, exceptionally modern and clean being such a new hotel. The staff on reception were extremely helpful (free WIFI in the lobby with a code from the staff on front desk) and the pamphlets in reception that have the metro system map in were invaluable for us, having never been to Berlin before. Berlin has an extremely efficient tranportation system! A note to point is that the hotel is in a fairly residential location and the walking journey from Bellevue station, the closest (5 minutes at most across the river to the right), would be quite daunting for single travellers on first sight, as you walk alongside the railway arches, which can be quite dark in evening, but we did not experience any trouble. In fact when we arrived there late there was a little cafe opposite and the owner russled us up a fine supper, I'm vegetarian and was surprised with how tasty it was, couldn't tell you it's exact name though! My partner, a meat eater, well he was equally impressed at the service at such a late hour!) Furthermore, location wise in the day, you are but a 10 min walk to the Brandenburg Gate, we did the journey daily, and nightly, after the magnificent New Years Eve celebrations! As for the rooms, they were modern, very clean, fairly compact with a fantastic shower! The only downside for us was that the walls must have been very thin as we were well aware of all the goings in the next room and we all like a bit of fun but hearing it while trying to sleep is not perfect! Take your ear plugs! Also, a valuable scarf of mine went missing from the room, the reception staff were obviously keen to return it but to no avail, we've no proof what happened there but just be aware. Apart from that, super hotel and we would stay again if we couldn't find something nearer to Hackescher Markt ( 5 mins from Bellevue by Metro) where we spent some time in the lovely Italian restaurants and bars/clubs (there's not that many and people aren't dressed to impress like UK nights out by the way, the girls mainly wore trousers/leggings, dresses skirts with thick tights and flat boots shin/knee and thigh high for the clubs we found, which is no problem but it's nice to know I guess!) Do make sure you take really comfortable boots/shoes to walk around in by day also, especially if visitng the many sights. The German Christmas Markets everywhere were extra special if visiting at the same time of year as we did! Overall, a new, modern hotel, conveniently located with friendly, helpful staff! :)

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: soleilrus
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel has just two stars, it feels more luxurious. Nice interiours (just like pictures on the website), good shower and bed, everything is clean, stylish lobby, friendly English-speaking staff, and, not unimportantly, nice cappuccinos. Free German newspapaers every day. The location is quite good: a 15-minute walk from the Hauptbahnhof and a 5-minute walk from Bellevue station. There were also bus stops in the area. All this for a reasonable price of 73 euros a night. Would definitely stay there again or try one of their hotels in other German cities.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget priced hotel, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: RocketRobin
Reviews.Content: This is my first stay at a Motel One. If the rest of them are this good they deserve to do well. Very stylish lobby area. excellent rooms, good breakfast and really quite inexpensive. The hotel seems new so everything looks very fresh and clean. The budget pricing does mean that you get quite a few young people there which gives it a somewhat back-packer atmosphere at breakfast; but don't let this put you off - it is still a good hotel for not much money. Really recommended, so much so that I'd be encouraged to stay at other Motel Ones too.
